briefdescription.para: The following PGProperty parameters all have addr: 0-NUM_PROPERTIES-1.
Property one push is available (int32 read)
Property has absolute (floating point) controls (int32 read)
The pixel format when VideoFormat=Format7 enum PixelFormat, 0-NUM_PIXEL_FORMATS-1 (int32 read/write)
The pixel format to convert to when input pixel format is raw[8,12,16] enum PixelFormat, 0-NUM_PIXEL_FORMATS-1 (int32 read/write)
Frames to skip in trigger mode 3 (int32 write/read)
Size of data packets from camera (int32 write/read)
Size of data packets from camera (int32 write/read)
Maximum size of data packets from camera (int32 write/read)
Packet delay in usec from camera, GigE only (int32 write/read)
Packet delay in usec from camera, GigE only (int32 read)
Packet resend enable, GigE only (int32 read/write)
Number of driver dropped frames (int32 read)

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *portName, int cameraId, int traceMask, int memoryChannel, int maxBuffers, size_t maxMemory, int priority, int stackSize)
memberdef.name: pointGrey

parameterdescription.para: asyn port name to assign to the camera.
The camera index or serial number.

The initial value of the asynTraceMask. If set to 0 or 1 then asynTraceMask will be set to ASYN_TRACE_ERROR. If set to 0x21 (ASYN_TRACE_WARNING | ASYN_TRACE_ERROR) then each call to the FlyCap2 library will be traced including during initialization.

The camera memory channel (non-volatile memory containing camera parameters) to load during initialization. If 0 no memory channel is loaded. If >=1 thenRestoreFromMemoryChannel(memoryChannel-1) is called. Set memoryChannel to 1 to work around a bug in the Linux GigE driver in R2.0.

Maxiumum number of NDArray objects (image buffers) this driver is allowed to allocate. This driver requires 2 buffers, and each queue element in a plugin can require one buffer which will all need to be added up in this parameter. 0=unlimited.
Maximum memory (in bytes) that this driver is allowed to allocate. So if max. size = 1024x768 (8bpp) and maxBuffers is, say 14. maxMemory = 1024x768x14 = 11010048 bytes (~11MB). 0=unlimited.
The EPICS thread priority for this driver. 0=use asyn default.
The size of the stack for the EPICS port thread. 0=use asyn default.

detaileddescription.para:
pasynUser
asynUser structure that contains the function code in pasynUser->reason.
value
The value for this parameter
Takes action if the function code requires it. ADAcquire, ADSizeX, and many other function codes make calls to the Firewire library from this function.

pasynUser
asynUser structure that contains the function code in pasynUser->reason.
value
The value for this parameter
Takes action if the function code requires it. The PGPropertyValueAbs function code makes calls to the Firewire library from this function.

memberdef.argsstring: (asynUser *pasynUser, char *strings[], int values[], int severities[], size_t nElements, size_t *nIn)
memberdef.name: readEnum

briefdescription.para: These should be private but are called from C callback functions, must be public.

detaileddescription.para: Print out a report; calls ADDriver::report to get base class report as well.

parameterdescription.para: File pointer to write output to
Level of detail desired. If >1 prints information about supported video formats and modes, etc.

briefdescription.para: Task to grab images off the camera and send them up to areaDetector.
Read all the propertyType settings and values from the camera.

detaileddescription.para: This function will collect all the current values and settings from the camera, and set the appropriate integer/double parameters in the param lib. If a certain propertyType is not available in the given camera, this function will set all the parameters relating to that propertyType to -1 or -1.0 to indicate it is not available. Note the caller is responsible for calling any update callbacks if I/O interrupts are to be processed after calling this function. Returns asynStatus asynError or asynSuccess as an int.

briefdescription.para: Main driver class inherited from areaDetectors ADDriver class.

detaileddescription.para: One instance of this class will control one camera.
